uas.lntv.pacmangame.Maps

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.tiles.StaticTiledMapTile
      • uas.lntv.pacmangame.Maps.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapTile

    public class Tile
extends com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.tiles.StaticTiledMapTile
    The whole map is divided in several tiles, these tiles are defined here. They contain coordinates, the information of which item is placed on it and also all the information that is needed by the Pathfinder to calculate the shortest path via A*.
    See Also:
    Pathfinder, Map

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tile()
      Creates a tile without a texture or special type.
      Tile(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion textureRegion)

      Creates a tile with a texture region and type and also puts it on the right place of the map.
      Tile(Tile.Type type, int x, int y)
      Puts a tile with it's attribute in the right place on the map without giving it a texture.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile()
        Creates a tile without a texture or special type. This would certainly be a raw tile, that will be changed soon.

      • Tile

        public Tile(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion textureRegion)
        Creates a tile with a texture region, that still needs to be put in place and needs to be characterized.
        Parameters:
        textureRegion - TILE_SIZE x TILE_SIZE pixels region of a texture

      • Tile

        public Tile(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion textureRegion,
            Tile.Type type,
            int x,
            int y)
        Creates a tile with a texture region and type and also puts it on the right place of the map.
        Parameters:
        textureRegion - TILE_SIZE x TILE_SIZE pixels region of a texture
        type - the kind of tile
        x - x-position in pixels
        y - y-position in pixels

      • Tile

        public Tile(Tile.Type type,
            int x,
            int y)
        Puts a tile with it's attribute in the right place on the map without giving it a texture.
        Parameters:
        type - the kind of tile
        x - x-position in pixels
        y - y-position in pixels
